revised_title: Meteorological Observations in Somersetshire and Cornwall in 1768
tldr: This article presents meteorological observations made in Bridgwater, Somersetshire, and Ludgvan, Cornwall, in 1768. The author records daily weather conditions, including temperature, wind direction, and rainfall, as well as barometric pressure readings. Notable events include a violent storm, a deep fall of snow, and a significant rainfall event. The observations provide a snapshot of the weather patterns in these regions during that time.
